CatDescriptText: Mrs. Mae Dial, hotel employee, of Herron Ave, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 26, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "In your opinion, what effect on the community do interracial churches have? Do you believe this type of membership should be encouraged?  Why?"  Answer reads: "It's good.  It helps to break down barriers and gets people to know each other.  It should be encouraged."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mae Dial, wearing dark collared coat, dark knit gloves with light colored decoration, and eyeglasses, holding dark handbag, standing on Liberty Avenue with Jenkins Arcade in background, Downtown
